Overview:
EXL (NASDAQ: EXLS) is a global analytics and digital solutions company that partners with clients to improve business outcomes and unlock growth. Bringing together domain expertise with robust data, powerful analytics, cloud and AI to create agile, scalable solutions and execute complex operations for the world’s leading corporations. EXL was founded on the core values of innovation, collaboration, excellence, integrity and respect creating value from data to ensure faster decision-making and transforming operating models. Key industries including Insurance, Healthcare, Banking and Financial Services, Media, and Retail among others.

Headquartered in New York, our team is over 40,000 strong, with more than 50 offices spanning six continents. For information, visit www.exlservice.com.

Role Title: Data Engineer (AWS)
BU/Segment: EXL Analytics / Insurance Analytics
Location: Fully Remote within the Republic of Ireland.
Employment Type: Permanent to start as soon as possible

Summary of the role:

EXL Analytics provides data-driven, action-oriented solutions to business problems through statistical data mining, innovative analytics techniques and a consultative approach. Leveraging proprietary methodology and best-of-breed technology, EXL Analytics takes an industry-specific approach to transform our clients’ decision-making and embed analytics more deeply into their business processes.
EXL Analytics offers an exciting, fast paced and innovative environment, which brings together a group of sharp and entrepreneurial professionals who are eager to influence business decisions. From your very first day, you get an opportunity to work closely with highly experienced, world class analytics consultants.
We are looking for a go-getter who can define:
Data strategies to meet the demands of business requirements
Technical requirements of the organizational data needs from diverse teams
Data architecture, models and go-forward data solutions for various teams of the organization

As part of your duties, you will be responsible for:
You will be part of the Data Solutions team for a major Insurance client. You will work with different stakeholders as SME for data engineering; A typical workday will involve working with stakeholders in individual contributor.
Would engage in technical problem solving across multiple technologies; often develop new solutions and recommend technologies that can be leveraged to create data solutions
Would develop, construct, test, and maintain data architectures for data platform, database and analytical/reporting systems.
Would partner with other technology platform teams to leverage innovative and new technology for delivering solutions that best fit internal data needs for various analytical solutions
Would handle codes independently, manage them and also guide other team members around its development/management
Qualifications and experience we consider to be essential for the role:
5+ years of experience in Data Engineering: SQL, DWH (Redshift or Snowflake), Python (PySpark), Spark and associated data engineering jobs.
Experience with AWS ETL pipeline services: Lambda, S3, EMR/Glue, Redshift(or Snowflake), step-functions (Preferred)
Experience with building and supporting cloud based ETL (Extract Transform Load) Data Pipelines
Excellent communication & presentation skills
Good to have working experience on RESTful API frameworks (Flask/FastAPI), Messaging Queue service (Kafka)
Should be able to work on a problem independently and prepare client ready deliverable with minimal or no supervision
Experience with working in an agile environment, development life cycle and with diverse stakeholders (like IT, Business, Project Managers etc)
General Insurance domain experience is preferred
Data Management Skillsets:
Ability to develop, enhance data models and identify ETL optimization opportunities. Exposure to ETL tools is going to help in the work
Should have strong grasp of advanced SQL functionalities (joins, nested query, procedures, PL/SQL)
Strong grasp of python libraries and concepts around PySpark, Numpy, Pandas, functions, constructors etc
Strong ability to translate functional specifications / requirements to technical requirements
Skills and Personal attributes we would like to have:
Bachelor’s/Master's degree in economics, mathematics, actuarial sciences, computer science/engineering, operations research or related analytics areas; candidates with BA/BS degrees in the same fields from the top tier academic institutions are also welcome to apply
Strong and in-depth understanding of DE Fundamentals
Exposure on designing ETL data pipelines and data analysis
Exposure on end-to-end data lifecycle management
Superior analytical and problem-solving skills
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Able to work in fast pace continuously evolving environment and ready to take up uphill challenges

As part of a leading global analytics and digital solutions company, you can look forward to:

A competitive salary with a generous bonus, private healthcare, life assurance at 4 x your annual salary, income protection insurance, and a rewarding pension.
At EXL, we are committed to providing our employees with the tools and resources they need to succeed and excel in their careers. We offer a wide range of professional and personal development opportunities. We also support a range of learning initiatives that allow our employees to build on their existing skills and knowledge. From online courses to seminars and workshops, our employees have the opportunity to enhance their skills and stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies.
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, EXL is committed to diversity. Our company does not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, age, or disability status.
At EXL, we offer a flexible hybrid working model that allows employees to live a balanced, healthy lifestyle while strengthening our culture of collaboration.
To be considered for this role, you must already be eligible to work in the Republic of Ireland.

Job Title: Network Engineer, Global Customer Services Edge Technologies
Description:
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Network Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in network routing protocol design and troubleshooting in BGP, OSPF, IS-IS, and MPLS.
Experience in one or more of the following: C, C++, Go or Python.
Experience with network equipment providers.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience in analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.
Experience developing networking products, technologies, software, and protocols.
Experience with data modeling, data modeling languages or network operations.
Operational experience with enterprise/carrier-class routers and switches.
Systematic problem-solving approach.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
About the job
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
As a Network Engineer on the Global Internet Edge team, you will help develop Google's interface to the Internet. Our core work includes conceptualizing, prototyping, testing, integrating, staging, piloting, making generally available, maintaining, and decommissioning the fundamental network architectures and software systems relating to the internet edge of Google’s global network.
Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
Responsibilities
Design, publish, and present network architectures, contributing to team roadmaps.
Develop software integrations for new architectures, and repair workflows and device configuration generation.
Develop pairwise integration tests, develop large-scale solutions, and run scale tests.
Publish feature and scale requirements and contribute to lifecycle plans of record.
Perform network-wide rollouts and manage escalations from our partner Site Reliability Engineering teams.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future.
ADI At A Glance
Analog Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ: ADI) is a global semiconductor leader that bridges the physical and digital worlds to enable breakthroughs at the Intelligent Edge. ADI combines analog, digital, and software technologies into solutions that help drive advancements in digitized factories, mobility, and digital healthcare, combat climate change, and reliably connect humans and the world. With revenue of more than $12 billion in FY22 and approximately 25,000 people globally working alongside 125,000 global customers, ADI ensures today’s innovators stay Ahead of What’s Possible.
At Analog Devices Research and Development (R&D) Centres in Limerick and Cork we are expanding our Software Development capabilities. ADI provides cutting edge technology to our customers and society in a creative environment that challenges our employees to be their best. We are looking for experienced, passionate and dedicated people to work with Analog Devices specialised hardware to create software solutions and systems to solve complex and global problems.
Joining Analog Devices in Ireland will place you at the centre of a world leader in mix-signal and digital solutions as we execute our long-term vision to build and empower the intelligent edge by bringing digital technologies and software closer to the edge.
About the Opportunity
As a graduate Software Engineer working in Analog Devices, you will work in all areas of software development lifecycle from requirements, software development, validation, and support. You will have access to a wealth of experience, knowledge and tools within Analog Devices, providing you with an unrivalled opportunity to develop your skills and career in a variety of technologies, applications and products.
This opportunity includes working in machine learning, robotics, embedded software, cloud computing, web-based applications, scripting and other technologies across Automotive, Internet of Things, Industrial Automation and Consumer products.
About you
To be successful requires a combination of skill, experience, knowledge and most importantly the desire to succeed. Analog Devices can teach you the skills, support you to develop the knowledge and provide the opportunity for experience but the successful candidate must bring the desire.

Job overview
Element Six would like to recruit for the position of Process Engineer reporting to the Process Manager. As part of the Engineering team, the primary role of the successful candidate will be to implement continuous & step change improvements to deliver yield, process capability, efficiency, and cost improvements. This role is a technical role, requiring problem solving through data analysis using good mechanical engineering & scientific methods.
Duties and tasks
– Ensure Safety is number one priority in all work carried out.
– Measure and Improve Process capability on agreed processes.
– Fully Document agreed processes using Control Plans, FMEAs, Standard Work Instructions and Reactions / Escalation plan.
– Analyse production data to identify opportunitiesfor improvements
– Project manage step change improvement projects to Deliver Yield Improvements, Cycle Time Reductions and Cost Savings.
– Work with cross functional teams to manage implementation of process improvements
– Problem solving and root cause analysis
– Value stream mapping and understanding the full process.
Skills and Experience
– Diploma / Degree in Engineering or related field or equivalent certification. Open to graduates with a co-op in Engineering.
– Ideally 2 years’ experience in Engineering
– Understanding of lean principles with demonstrated experience having achieved a yellow & green belt
– Make timely, informed decisions that are data-driven, and aligned with goals, constraints, and risks.
– Excellent communication, people and team working skills
– A team player with a can do, pro-active attitude and a passion for improvement.
– Good understanding of health and safety standards as well as quality standards, environmental and sustainability standards.
– Proficiency in MS Office software
– Minitab an advantage.

Element Six (E6), is a global leader in the design, development and production of synthetic diamond and tungsten carbide supermaterials. Part of the De Beers Group, our primary manufacturing sites are located in UK, Ireland, Germany, South Africa and the US.

This role has been designated as ‘Edge’, which means you will primarily work outside of an HPE office.
Job Description:

Advance the way you live and work at HPE.
Who We Are:
A career in the HPE GreenLake Platform Cloud (GLCP) team allows you the opportunity to create history and push the industry forward, redefining the state of the art in what cloud computing means. Come and help us build a large scale, enterprise ready platform, powering a hybrid edge-to-cloud world. Our platform allows some of the largest most diverse enterprises in the world to deliver with speed, agility, and scale – while keeping their data where it needs to be, and ensuring their sustainability and green goals are met and exceeded.
Our team members search beyond customers' needs today to accelerate what’s next and make a difference — for others, our company, and the planet. Our customers turn to us because we are positive, empathetic and enterprising. Nowhere is this better reflected than in our running in production with over 100,000 dedicated customers and over 1 million devices.
We embrace opportunities to accelerate transformation across data, connectivity, cloud and security. From vital solutions for small businesses with a single storefront to essential applications for large retail chains with thousands of locations. Together we make what was once thought impossible, possible.
For more information about HPE GreenLake, please check out the following youtube link - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zt6R8mITp5E
What you'll do:
GreenLake Cloud Platform is an internally developed innovative cloud-stack that powers HPE’s Cloud Solutions. The GreenLake Cloud Platform is a unified operational experience that provides a simplified view and access to all cloud services, spanning the entire HPE portfolio, with single sign-on access, security, compliance, elasticity, and data protection. The Greenlake Cloud Platform is the foundation to a rich set of cloud services in networking, data services, high performance computing and compute operations management.
The Greenlake Cloud Platform team offers the opportunity to apply your knowledge and experience to contribute to architecting and building the platform and applications on a top distributed backend. Be part of a fast-paced development team and learn how to build solutions that make a difference.
You will be joining an agile, empowered team, focused on building a range of applications and features for HPE GreenLake. The team leverages the latest cloud, micro-frontend, microservice based technologies – Java, JavaScript, GoLang, Python, Scala, Apache Spark, Delta Lake, Apache Pulsar, Kubernetes, Istio, GraphQL, TimescaleDB, Postgres and many more.
We don’t expect you to have all the skills. We are a learning focused organization and we do expect you to fold into that ethos. We will invest in you.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Collaborate across the broader HPE GreenLake team to design and develop features that extend and enhance the power of HPE GreenLake platform.
Be part of a collaborative Agile feature team tightly coupled with product owners, developers, system integrators, QA, data scientists and DevOps engineers.
Leverage cloud/big data technologies for data processing, cloud application and data analytics features.
Develop unit, integration, sub-system, system and performance tests that are needed to help the team deliver value quickly, with a high degree of quality
Help address customer field issues in response to support escalations, customer requests, etc.
Document functional and technical specifications for application enhancements.
Cultivate and hone applicable skills in native cloud development through targeted training and work assignments
Education and Experience Required:
B.E./B.Sc. or M. Eng./MSc. degree in Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent
Knowledge and Skills (you will likely not have all of these but need a mindset to grow and learn):
Experience or understanding of cloud native software systems design tools and languages – Jira (or equivalent), GitHub, Docker, Kubernetes, Java, JavaScript, React, GoLang, Python, Linux scripting, Terraform, Puppet, React JS, Ansible, Scala …
Understanding of public cloud solutions e.g. AWS, Azure
Knowledge of virtualization
Some experience of development in any of the following: Rest APIs, Microservices, Front End application subsystems, Back end applications
Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
Understanding of design for software systems running on multiple platform types
Understanding of basic coding, testing (unit, functional, black box, performance) and debugging procedures
Strong written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English.

Named a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion for the sixth year in row

Benefits Experience and Technology is building new technology and services to deliver an integrated, end-to-end experience for all Amazonians to discover, enroll, and manage Amazon benefits including health, life, retirement, time-off, commuter, discounts, and others. We are looking for an experienced software development engineer who will be a peer leader to a team of top-notch engineers to build a new platform to manage data exchange and transformation.

This person has thrived and succeeded in delivering high quality technology products/services in a hyper-growth environment where priorities shift fast.

About the team
Benefits Experience and Technology is a relatively new organization. Amazon has been reliant on vendor services for benefits, and we're just now taking the opportunity to build in-house technology to provide the best experience for Amazonians!

MS in Computer Science or equivalent

Experience with speech and language understanding systems

You became an engineer because you believed in technology’s ability to make a difference in the world. So why would you spend your days building things that don’t matter?
Groupon is an experiences marketplace that brings people more ways to get the most out of their city or wherever they may be. By enabling real-time mobile commerce across local businesses, live events and travel destinations, Groupon helps people find and discover experiences––big and small, new and familiar––that make for a full, fun and rewarding life. Groupon helps local businesses grow and strengthen customer relationships––resulting in strong, vibrant communities. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking and celebrates success.
Groupon's SEM & Display Marketing Team is committed to expanding the online presence of our local & goods business by purchasing & placing display ads on the world's biggest display networks. It efficiently advertises Groupon through online display and mobile app marketing. These services tap into available ad inventory sources, including social networks, internet portals, affiliates, and display and mobile inventory exchanges. Our goal is to put the highest value offer/message in front of each customer for each specific placement, to know the ROI of advertising opportunity, while operating at massive, global scale. These services will need to be built with internationalization and localization support to launch and scale them in the 28 countries we operate currently.
You’ll spend time on the following:
You will take ownership of the technical aspects of our global technology infrastructure, ensuring that the platform is being used to its fullest potential through designing and building applications around our customer’s needs
You will review and monitor current engineering work, as well as previously constructed applications, to ensure the software is running as smoothly as possible
Work directly with our internal product teams to ensure that our technology infrastructure is seamlessly and effectively integrated with our third-party software, conceive and build the necessary applications to make this happen
We’re excited about you if you have:
BS degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
Solid foundational Computer Science knowledge (e.g. data structures, algorithms, testing practices)
Expertise in Java
Must demonstrate strong coding ability
Previous experience working in collaborative technical teams (e.g. class projects, hackathons, previous work experience, open source projects)
Ability to apply creative problem solving skills

THE ROLE & THE TEAM
The Product Data Quality team is looking for a talented Software Engineer who has a passion for building applications at the intersection of data science and engineering. Our team consists of a great mix of Software Engineers, Product Managers and Applied Scientists that are tasked with understanding, enriching and improving the product information (data and media content) for Zalando's assortment of millions of live products. To achieve these aims we use a combination of Machine Learning, Rules Engines, Human Annotation UIs, Data Dashboards and Data Pipelines (using both batch and streaming architectures).

As an Engineer on the Product Data Quality team, you will work across the entire stack to build, serve and monitor cloud-based data processing architectures that intelligently combine ML insights from multiple independent data sources and combine them to identify and correct quality issues in our product information in a scalable and maintainable way. We work with a leading edge technology stack comprised of Python, Kotlin, Kubernetes, RESTful APIs, Tensorflow, Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL, BigQuery, DynamoDB and other AWS services amongst others - check out our Tech Blog for more information on the technologies we use.
INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN
At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.
We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.
do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy: https://corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups: https://corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups
WHAT WE'D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)
As an Engineer you will play a role in the development, deployment and production monitoring across team's systems.
You will build and maintain software architecture for data products that evolve over time.
You will continuously ship high quality testable and reliable systems.
You will be agile, iteratively test features with stakeholders while keeping the big picture in mind.
You will have a focus on team processes, automation, communication and collaboration to support the velocity and output of the team.
WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF
We're looking for smart people with strong engineering experience and skills, who care about solving tangible customer problems.
We have a varied tech stack, we expect you to be comfortable working across it and learning new languages, technologies and systems to use the right tool for the job. (Think AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, Python, PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch).
You can thrive in a collaborative environment involving many different stakeholders, including Product and Data Science teams.
You are someone whose values resonate with ours.
You are someone who loves engineering: designing, making and breaking things!
If you think you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every single requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!
OUR OFFER

Customer Liaison:

Preparation of all necessary Quality documentation as requested by customers – Product Spec Manuals, Work Instructions (inc photographs), SOP, measurement reports (ISIR’s), process capability studies,

Quality System:

Ensure current information is available in the production area and in a presentable format that meets both customer and standard requirements
Ensure that document control is maintained at all times
Maintain customer complaints recording procedures to standard. Lead failsafe meetings and maintain 8D response system to customer and Standard requirements
Monitor vendor control and assessment system (NCMR’s) and ensure problem vendors are identified and controls implemented to prevent problem reaching Mergon product.

New Products (as needed):
Liaise with Product Development on new products and changes to existing products (under customer and ISO procedures)
Generate FMEA’s and develop control plans for new and existing products and use corrective and preventative tools within the plant.
Work with the customer to ensure PIS documents are submitted and approved in a timely manner.
Ensure customer specific test requirements are completed in accordance with the relevant ISO Standard or customer specified requirement.
Review Material to meet the IMDS “International Material Data System” requirements.
Member of new projects development team

Continuous Improvement:
Participate in continuous improvement activities within the plant
Carry out audits to ensure that procedures are adhered to and with to ensure the that quality systems in place are effective

Training
Carry out Operator training


Who we’re looking for?

Have a relevant 3rd level qualification with 4+ years quality experience post-graduation
Experience with IATF 16949 and ISO regulations
Experience in moulding environment (injection or blow moulding) would be beneficial but not essential
Experience in driving continuous improvement projects is essential
The ability to blend best practices from different methodologies to deliver results (Six Sigma, Lean, Kaizen)
Demonstrated methodical and analytical approach
Strong attention to detail with structured approach to planning & organising
Be able to work on own initiative and priorities work as required
Have excellent communication skills

Job Title: Software Engineer, Infrastructure, Looker Production Engineering, DevOps
Description:
Note: Google’s hybrid workplace includes remote and in-office roles. By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:

In-office locations: Dublin, Ireland.
Remote location(s): Ireland.
Minimum qualifications:
Experience working with Cloud technologies.
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
Experience in distributed processing.
Experience with Linux.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience in architecting, designing, and developing on Kubernetes platforms.
Experience with any one of the following programming languages such as Go, Python, Java, C++.
Experience working with Cloud providers.
Ability to solve complex problems into simple tasks.
Ability to develop leadership of large projects and deliver them through collaboration.
About the job
Google Cloud's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google Cloud's needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. You will anticipate our customer needs and be empowered to act like an owner, take action and innovate. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.
Looker is on a mission to bring data-driven insights and decisions to every business. Looker Production Engineering or DevOps team brings Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) practices and approaches towards supporting Looker production systems.
The Production Engineering team is an integral part of Looker engineering and our team keeps the Looker production environments stable and reliable. We are distributed in three different timezones (e.g., United States, Ireland, India) to support our production systems.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
Responsibilities
Design or develop features related to orchestration, integration, and automation of multiple infrastructure services across major cloud providers to support customers.
Lead increases in performance, reliability, availability, and observability into existing functionality.
Exemplify technical excellence in collaborative planning, implementation, and review of code.
Lead technical discussions and designs in support of high quality and maintainability of systems.
Engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of services from inception and design, through deployment, operation, and refinement.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Job Title: BI Developers, Data Architects, Data Engineers - Data Analytics, Digital
Description:
Description
BI Developers, Data Architects, Data Engineers - Data Analytics, Digital
A&M Momentum (Alvarez & Marsal)
Ireland
Alvarez & Marsal (“A&M”) is a global consulting firm with more than $2+ billion in revenues, c. 7,500 staff and over 70 offices worldwide. We offer a broad range of professional services to Private Equity funds, Corporates and Financial Services clients across Europe.
A&M Digital EMEA is a dynamic and growing practice that provides a wide range of Digital advisory services (DTS). We have evolved digital into a unique proposition that is built on data and analytics, customer and workforce experience, sales and marketing, and new digital business models in a way that strongly complements our existing service offerings and turnaround, results-driven heritage. We help transform the performance of companies facing, or at risk of, digital disruption and provide practical advice on how every aspect of a business can be digitally enabled sustainably, and at scale.
Momentum is the latest team from A&M Digital and Technology Services (DTS) and provides cutting-edge IT and digital services to our clients. Momentum will work on client site as the digital & technology delivery arm of A&M to provide tailored solutions to meet the unique needs of our clients. The Momentum team is composed of highly skilled technology professionals ranging from IT project manager to UX expert. Momentum will be an integral part of A&M offering and is expected to be a catalyst for the further growth of DTS.
We strive to build strong and lasting relationships with our clients by delivering value-driven services and fostering a culture of innovation and excellence that is unparalleled in the industry. This is the perfect place for those looking for a rewarding career in the IT and digital services industry.
Our Data services include:
Data Governance, Master Data Management
Procurement optimization and digitalization
Data Driven Performance and operational improvement (Board reporting, management reporting, Operational reporting)
Advanced Analytics, Big Data, Optimization of business processes using data tools
Personnel Productivity analytics
We are looking for experienced Data Analytics Developers, Data Engineers and Data Architects to deliver large, complex client engagements. This is a fantastic opportunity to work within an innovative team to apply state-of-the-art analytics to real world business challenges. Grades available include Senior Consultant / Consultant / Junior Consultant (based on experience).
The roles will be based in Dublin with hybrid working policies and there may be some ad-hoc requirements for client visits in the UK and continental Europe.
In this role you will have the opportunity to work on many exciting European and Global projects enabling our clients to positively change their businesses and enhance their performance. The successful candidates will:
Develop rapid prototypes to illustrate clear data-driven business value
Combine different tools and technologies to develop end to end analytical solutions that address our clients’ business challenges
Apply predictive analytics, statistical modelling and machine learning/deep learning techniques
Stay up to date with developments in the field of Data Analytics, Cloud data analysis tools, RPA, NLP, Streaming data, AI and Machine Learning, data architecture and scripting/programming languages and low code tools
Work as part of a diverse team within an inclusive team culture where people are recognised for their contribution
The candidate will reflect the operational distinctiveness that is A&M; a business savvy, outcome focused business entrepreneur who is driven to making an impact, determined to make a difference and not afraid to challenge the status-quo.
The successful candidate will be a problem solver, and a data expert with hands on experience of data analytics gained at a leading advisory, consulting or data analytics firm.
Additional requirements include:
Strong academic record and certifications of data tools and particularly the Microsoft data toolset
Experience in PowerBI or other data visualisation tools: e.g., Tableau, Qlik, Spotfire
Experience in Relational Databases/SQL, including working with large datasets in Azure Data Factory / Azure Data Warehouse / Azure Synapse. Azure D900 certification or above
A collaborative spirit and the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively to both colleagues and clients
Excellent attention to detail and ability to work to tight deadlines
Experience in delivering data projects across multiple business disciplines and business types
Independent self-starter – A&M Momentum has a culture of problem solving, we expect team members to be highly comfortable working independently as well as part of a broader team
Excellent interpersonal skills, verbal and written communication skills when working with both business and technical teams
Highly desirable:
Experience with predictive modelling, machine learning and AI techniques
Experience in Alteryx or other low code tools
Experience with RPA, OCR and web scraping
Experience with Machine Learning tools (e.g., Sagemaker, Azure Machine learning)
Fast learner, eager to learn new technologies.
Fluency in one or more European languages, in addition to English, is desirable although not essential
Programming skills in at least one of the following languages: R, Python
Irish or dual UK–EU country nationality (or work permit) allowing work both in the UK and EU

NetApp Introduction

Organizations count on NetApp for cutting-edge ways to store, manage, move and protect their data. And we never let them down. Continually breaking new ground is the norm here. We make sure of it with an open, collaborative culture that fuels fresh thinking. Right from day one, we’ll encourage you to share your views, challenge opinions and push boundaries. And thanks to mentoring and leadership programs that help you build on your personal and professional passions, you’ll develop your skills as fast as your ideas.

As a company committed to developing our future workforce, we created a program that enables our University Graduate Hires to fast track their careers through classroom and on-the-job training and clear benchmarks. At the start of the program, if sanitary regulations allow us, we will fly you to the United States to take part in our robust 90-day training program based in Raleigh Durham NC, USA, facilities designed for entry-level talent. During this training, Academy Participants gain the foundational knowledge needed to have a basic understanding of the Storage Industry, NetApp, and products and solutions. Additionally, they effectively develop transferable soft skills that will allow them to excel within the organization and in their long-term careers. To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter and self-learner, possess strong customer service and technical problem-solving skills; and be someone who embraces challenges.

Job Summary

As a Technical Support Engineer with Development Skills, you will be involved in the automation enhancements and development of tools like case automation, data processing / parsing tools and others. You will also provide remote technical support to customers, customer support personnel, and field support staff, focused on diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing, and debugging NetApp products. Support incidents can range from various hardware and/or software issues with NetApp storage systems and solutions, to multi-system, multi-vendor, and multinetwork interoperability issues. The experience supporting NetApp customers you will effectively use in your automation efforts.

Enhancement and development of tools for automation of processes
Research customer issues and follow up directly with customers on recommendations and action plans.
Collaborate with other Technical Support Engineers who may need assistance working a case; utilize your area of expertise to help them in order to most quickly facilitate solutions for customers.
Escalate cases to other more senior Technical Support Engineers and/or Escalation Engineers when the problem is too complex or falls out of specific area of expertise.
Essential Functions
Good written and verbal communication skills
Any Programming skills: Perl, Python, C, SQL, JavaScript.
Good interpersonal communication and customer service skills are needed in order to work successfully with customers in high stress and/or ambiguous situations.
Strong aptitude for learning new technologies and understanding how to utilize them in a customer-facing environment.
Ability to follow standard engineering principles and practices.
Creative approach to problem solving.
Basic understanding or eagerness to learn the following protocols and applications:
Linux/Docker
CIFS, the Windows NT remote file sharing protocol
Cloud - google cloud/AWS/Azure
TCP/IP and Networking
Familiar with Virtualization and Cloud Technologies

Typically requires no previous professional experience.

Your Profile

We are looking for those with Bachelor degrees in any one of the following disciplines: Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Information Technology, Information Systems, Business Informatics.

We are an equal opportunities employer and are seeking different levels of experience for this training program
You could be a final year student due to complete your studies in July 2023 OR
A recent degree graduate in the past 3 years (from June 2020 onwards) looking for new role OR
Someone who has developed professional experience in the absence of a degree
A career switcher looking for a break into Tech Support and an employer who will provide all the training
Fluent English + one of the additional language Italian, Hebrew, German, French, Spanish is needed
You must have the unrestricted right to work in Ireland
As the training takes place in the US, you will also need to hold a valid passport and be willing to spend 90 days living and working in the US. NetApp will fund the flights, costs of accommodation while you are in Raleigh

Job Title: Senior Software Development Engineer, Benefits Technology - Global Healthcare
Description:
8+ years of professional software development experience
8+ years of programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
2+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering
Benefits Experience and Technology is building new technology and services to deliver an integrated, end-to-end experience for all Amazonians to discover, enroll, and manage Amazon benefits including health, life, retirement, time-off, commuter, discounts, and others. Our team delivers comprehensive employee benefits and offers individualized support to fellow employees navigating personal and professional life events.

We are looking for an experienced software development engineer who will be a peer leader to a team of top-notch engineers to build a new platform to manage data exchange and transformation.

Key job responsibilities
As a Senior SDE on the team you will be responsible for leading the development and launch of core services and product features for Benefits Tech. You will have significant influence on our overall strategy by helping define these product features, drive the system architecture, and spearhead the best practices that enable a quality product.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about new opportunities and has a demonstrable track record of success in delivering new features and products. A commitment to team work, bias for action, and strong communication skills (to both business and technical partners) are absolute requirements. Creating reliable, scalable, and high performance products requires exceptional technical expertise, a sound understanding of the fundamentals of Computer Science, and practical experience building large-scale distributed systems. This person has thrived and succeeded in delivering high quality technology products/services in a hyper-growth environment where priorities shift fast.

About the team
Benefits Experience and Technology is a relatively new organization. Amazon has been reliant on vendor services for benefits, and we're just now taking the opportunity to build in-house technology to provide the best experience for Amazonians!

MS in Computer Science or equivalent
Experience developing cloud software services and an understanding of design for scalability, performance and reliability
Development experience defining, developing and maintaining REST based interfaces
Excellence in technical communication with peers and non-technical cohorts
Experience building developer facing products and services
Experience building frameworks for creating applications on various platforms
Experience with speech and language understanding systems
Strong sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.
Demonstrated leadership abilities in an engineering environment in driving operational excellence and best practices.
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need an adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please contact the Applicant-Candidate Accommodation Team (ACAT), Monday through Friday from 7:00 am GMT - 4:00 pm GMT. If calling directly from the United Kingdom, please dial +44 800 086 9884 (tel: +448000869884). If calling from Ireland, please dial +353 1800 851 489 (tel: +3531800851489).

AMAX Ireland is the EU division of AMAX Engineering Corporation. We are a global leader in high- performance/high-efficiency Cloud, AI, and HPC computing solutions serving the software, hardware ICT, cloud and data center industries. Specialising in
GPU-integrated platforms for AI and large- scale data centre deployments, AMAX works closely with its customers to custom-configure the highest quality solutions designed for maximum performance. AMAX is headquartered in Silicon Valley and has a global presence in Asia. Discover more at http://www.amax.com.
Essential Functions
. Work jointly with the Sales and Marketing team to identify customer pain points, develop technical solutions, and address any technical objections for prospects and clients.
. Interact with customer's stakeholders to interpret and evaluate business objectives.
· Seek requirements and propose technology solutions using different programs.
· Support the requirements of gathering and designing technical specifications to solve a customer's needs.
· Train customers and teams on products and advise them on the best practices for using technology applications.
Education and Experience
BS degree in Engineering or equivalent
Working experience in enterprise technical support, IT support or as a technical engineer
Basic knowledge of HPC, Cloud, Big data, etc
Knowledge in cluster management s/w and GPU/CUDA
Experience in Unix/Linux CLI
Strong h/w knowledge of x86 server platforms and related components
Strong h/w troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Excellent client-facing skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Job Type: Full-time
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Day shift
Monday to Friday
Work Location: In person

You became an engineer because you believed in technology’s ability to make a difference in the world. So why would you spend your days building things that don’t matter?
Groupon is an experiences marketplace that brings people more ways to get the most out of their city or wherever they may be. By enabling real-time mobile commerce across local businesses, live events and travel destinations, Groupon helps people find and discover experiences––big and small, new and familiar––that make for a full, fun and rewarding life. Groupon helps local businesses grow and strengthen customer relationships––resulting in strong, vibrant communities. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking and celebrates success.
Groupon's SEM & Display Marketing Team is committed to expanding the online presence of our local & goods business by purchasing & placing display ads on the world's biggest display networks. It efficiently advertises Groupon through online display and mobile app marketing. These services tap into available ad inventory sources, including social networks, internet portals, affiliates, and display and mobile inventory exchanges. Our goal is to put the highest value offer/message in front of each customer for each specific placement, to know the ROI of advertising opportunity, while operating at massive, global scale. These services will need to be built with internationalization and localization support to launch and scale them in the 28 countries we operate currently.
You’ll spend time on the following:
You will take ownership of the technical aspects of our global technology infrastructure, ensuring that the platform is being used to its fullest potential through designing and building applications around our customer’s needs
You will review and monitor current engineering work, as well as previously constructed applications, to ensure the software is running as smoothly as possible
Work directly with our internal product teams to ensure that our technology infrastructure is seamlessly and effectively integrated with our third-party software, conceive and build the necessary applications to make this happen
We’re excited about you if you have:
BS degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
Solid foundational Computer Science knowledge (e.g. data structures, algorithms, testing practices)
Expertise in Java
Must demonstrate strong coding ability
Previous experience working in collaborative technical teams (e.g. class projects, hackathons, previous work experience, open source projects)
Ability to apply creative problem solving skills

Groupon’s purpose is to build strong communities through thriving small businesses. To learn more about the world’s largest local ecommerce marketplace, click here for the latest Groupon news. Plus, be sure to check out the values that shape our culture, guide our strategy and make our company a great place to work. And just don’t take our word for it. Hear from real Groupon team members, learn more about our inclusive employee groups, and check out our benefits. If all of this sounds like something that’s a great fit for you, then click apply and let’s see where this takes us.

Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare.
ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future.
ADI At A Glance
Analog Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ: ADI) is a global semiconductor leader that bridges the physical and digital worlds to enable breakthroughs at the Intelligent Edge. ADI combines analog, digital, and software technologies into solutions that help drive advancements in digitized factories, mobility, and digital healthcare, combat climate change, and reliably connect humans and the world. With revenue of more than $12 billion in FY22 and approximately 25,000 people globally working alongside 125,000 global customers, ADI ensures today’s innovators stay Ahead of What’s Possible.
Analog Devices is committed to investing in our people and their growth. One way we can do this is by establishing a cutting-edge Entry Level Hiring program. This program features high impact professional development, opportunities to drive meaningful projects that are directly tied to business goals, and unique executive exposure. Our duty is to develop the next generation of talent in our communities and provide them with a pathway to apply their academic skills in the real-world. At ADI, our early career hires will learn from the brightest minds who are dedicated to their growth, development, and success. From an industry perspective, incoming new career hires are surrounded by employees that represent the best of the best minds in their respective fields.
Apply now for the opportunity to grow your career and help innovate ahead of what’s possible!
The Energy Storage Systems Team are seeking a motivated, experienced Applications Engineer to provide support to our Sustainable Energy unit located at ADI’s limerick site. We are seeking to develop energy storage solutions across Grid, utility residential storage, centered on battery management. This is a challenging role for an engineer, who will work in a close working group, where significant systems level experience will be obtained.
Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
Design and development systems solutions
HW & SW development
System architecture development with some introduction to functional safety
Customer interaction regarding requirements gathering and demonstration
System level documentation development, white papers and applications notes
Minimum qualifications
Batchelor’s degree in Electronic Engineer, systems engineering or equivalent
HW and SW development skills
Simulation modelling LTspice, Matlab\Simulink or equivalent
Good Communications skills to articulate the development stages and progress.
Preferred qualifications but not required
Background in Energy or energy storage systems or equivalent
Lithium-ion Battey management knowledge
Some general knowledge of power conversion

Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare.
ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future.
ADI At A Glance
Analog Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ: ADI) is a global semiconductor leader that bridges the physical and digital worlds to enable breakthroughs at the Intelligent Edge. ADI combines analog, digital, and software technologies into solutions that help drive advancements in digitized factories, mobility, and digital healthcare, combat climate change, and reliably connect humans and the world. At Analog Devices Research and Development (R&D) Centres in Limerick and Cork we are expanding our Software Development capabilities. ADI provides cutting edge technology to our customers and society in a creative environment that challenges our employees to be their best. We are looking for experienced, passionate and dedicated people to work with Analog Devices specialised hardware to create software solutions and systems to solve complex and global problems.
Joining Analog Devices in Ireland will place you at the centre of a world leader in mix-signal and digital solutions as we execute our long-term vision to build and empower the intelligent edge by bringing digital technologies and software closer to the edge.
About the Opportunity
As a graduate Software Engineer working in Analog Devices, you will work in all areas of software development lifecycle from requirements, software development, validation, and support. You will have access to a wealth of experience, knowledge and tools within Analog Devices, providing you with an unrivalled opportunity to develop your skills and career in a variety of technologies, applications and products.
This opportunity includes working in machine learning, robotics, embedded software, cloud computing, web-based applications, scripting and other technologies across Automotive, Internet of Things, Industrial Automation and Consumer products.
About you
To be successful requires a combination of skill, experience, knowledge and most importantly the desire to succeed. Analog Devices can teach you the skills, support you to develop the knowledge and provide the opportunity for experience but the successful candidate must bring the desire.
In addition
A Batchelors degree or higher in Electronics Engineering or Software Engineering discipline with knowledge of some of the following languages C, C++, Java, Ruby, Python/Perl, Matlab.
Interest in technologies and how Analog Devices technology is applied to solve problems.
The ability to work in a team, support and learn from your colleagues and achieve collective goals.
Proactive approach to problem solving, willingness to try and fail before succeeding
Good communication skills
Operating system knowledge of Linux, Windows, or Real-Time OSs.

Knowledge of software engineering practices and frameworks such as Agile and Waterfall

Required Travel: Yes, 10% of the time

Minimum qualifications:
Experience in network routing protocol design and troubleshooting in BGP, OSPF, IS-IS, and MPLS.
Experience in one or more of the following: C, C++, Go, or Python.
Experience with IP networking in a production environment.
Experience with network equipment providers (Juniper, Cisco, Arista, Nokia, etc.).

Preferred qualifications:
Experience developing networking products, technologies, software, and protocols.
Operational experience with carrier-class routers and switches.
Ability to debug, optimize code, and automate routine tasks.
Systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with excellent verbal/written communication skills and a sense of ownership and drive.
Interest in designing, analyzing, and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.
About the job
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
Core Network Engineering provides comprehensive long-term development, automation, and engineering of Google’s attachment points at the edge. New Production Introduction is the development function responsible for introducing new hardware, topology, and network designs to the network. Specifically, the NPI team's mission is to provide technology continuity which allows the network to continuously scale, increase efficiency and reliability, and satisfy new use cases demanded by the business.
Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
Responsibilities
Engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of networks from inception and design, to qualification and validation, through deployment, operation, and optimization.
Scale systems sustainably through mechanisms like automation, and evolve systems by pushing for changes that improve reliability and velocity.
Work with other team members and groups to analyze requirements or potential problems and proactively develop solutions and policy recommendations.
Partner with Google’s internal application groups and design network infrastructure which meets their networking requirements.
Lead development of Google’s production network infrastructure through published engineering design documents and specifications, lead the requirement analysis, engineering design, and solution development of Google’s production network infrastructure.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. Job Title: Data Analytics and Insights Lead - Renewal Management
Description:
Company Overview

DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives.


What you'll do

The Data Analytics & Insights Lead is a highly motivated self-starter who will leverage their expertise to analyze data related to customer renewals, identifying trends and insights, and making recommendations to improve renewal rates. The role involves working with large amounts of data, using statistical and analytical techniques to identify patterns, and presenting findings to key stakeholders. The position also requires collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop and implement strategies to improve customer retention. The Candidate will develop and track key metrics related to customer renewals, such as renewal rate, revenue retention, customer satisfaction, time to renew, upsell/cross-sell opportunities, and churn rate.

The ideal candidate has business analysis and reporting experience in a corporate environment with ability to understand data trends and key insights and tell “data stories” with minimal extraneous data. You will partner closely with Customer Success business stakeholders, data scientists and data engineers to collect requirements for existing or new reporting metrics. You will apply analytical, modeling, forecasting and business process improvement capabilities to complete assignments faster, more effectively and independently while supporting continuous improvement and other enhancements across GTM Strategy and Operations by completing special projects that may bring value to multiple team members. This role requires the ability to deliver assigned projects related to developing datasets and reporting on time and to the specifications required while applying extra care and attention to detailed business process and workflow design to optimize quality, time and scale.

This position is an individual contributor reporting to Sr Manager , Analytics.

Responsibility
Collect, analyze, and interpret data related to customer renewals to identify trends and insights.
Develop analytic datasets and reports for key metrics and KPIs to help business leaders answer critical questions related to renewal management portfolio effectiveness
Combine analytics, exploratory skills, and data intuition to deliver insights on Renewal rate, NetRetention Rate, Churn .
Understand business requirements and acceptance criteria for complex tasks or projects
Create and maintain dashboards and reports to track key renewal metrics.
Work collaboratively with other analysts and data engineers to determine opportunities for improvement across process, tooling, and data automation to optimize costs and decrease turnaround time for analytics consumers
Develop statistical models coordinating with data scientists to predict customer renewal rates and identify opportunities for improvement.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analytics and renewal management.

Valeo is a tech global company, designing breakthrough solutions to reinvent the mobility. We are an automotive supplier partner to automakers and new mobility actors worldwide. Our vision? Invent a greener and more secured mobility, thanks to solutions focusing on intuitive driving and reducing CO2 emissions. We are leader on our businesses, and recognized as one of the largest global innovative companies.
Company Overview
Headquartered in Tuam, Co. Galway, Valeo Vision Systems VVS is the world leader in providing advanced driver-assistance and automated parking systems. The Computer Vision Department is responsible for developing custom-built state-of-the-art algorithms intrinsically designed to leverage the full power of today's most advanced multi-core automotive embedded platforms. Computer vision functions including 3D object detection, pedestrian and vehicle classification, trajectory mapping, online calibration, lens soiling detection, collision mitigation, lane and park-slot detection, and much more feed into a detailed map of the vehicle's environment via advanced sensor fusion. The department apply state of the art computer vision techniques to the automotive domain; object detection, classification, structure-from-motion, localisation & mapping, and machine & deep learning. The team specialise in redefining state-of-the-art computer vision and delivering next-generation advanced driver-assistance and automated driving systems for leading European, American and Asian OEMs.
Position Overview
As a deep learning engineer, you will be responsible for the development of deep learning solutions enabling the next generation Automated Driving Platforms. Deep learning will be applied to classify all objects, road markings and surfaces in the vehicle environment. You will be responsible for the development of state of the art DL algorithms providing unprecedented scene understanding. You will be expected to remain abreast of technological developments in the rapidly expanding field of deep learning and its application in automotive.
Responsibilities
Perform state-of-the-art research into deep learning approaches, methodologies and tools.
Develop machine learning applications according to requirements
Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods
Work with data engineers and analysts to ensure optimal data acquisition, data integrity and data pipelines
Support in definition of test and validation strategy
Design, develop, train, and optimize Deep Neural Networks with a view to deploying on embedded platforms.
Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results
Extend existing ML libraries and frameworks
Keep abreast of developments in the field
Support Intellectual Property activities and generate Invention Disclosure Memos to facilitate patent applications.
Contribute to design reviews across algorithm teams.
Represent VVS at various Industry Working Groups and at Conferences where directed.
Support the design and implementation of in-company training sessions in your area of expertise.
Develop and maintain a relationship with university counterparts.
Qualifications - External
Required Skills/Experience
BSc degree and 2+ years of work experience, or MSc degree and 1+ years of work experience, or PhD in any area with a focus on deep learning.
Understanding of fundamental computer vision algorithms and approaches, with a focus on machine learning.
Excellent English language communication skills, both written and verbal.
High level of innovation and motivation .
Desired Attributes
Specialisation in Machine Learning preferred.
Applied Deep Learning work experience preferred.
Academic publications in relevant field
Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture
Proficiency with Python, machine learning frameworks (Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn)
Proficiency with OpenCV
Familiarity with Linux
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work in a team
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with parallel programming in CUDA, or OpenCL
Algorithm development experience in robotics, sensor fusion, computer vision or applicable field
Knowledge of UML design tools
Experience developing software for embedded platforms.
Experience with version control software
Experience developing algorithms for autonomous and/or real-time systems.
Experience with imaging or optics systems.
Automotive industry experience.

Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare.
ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future.
ADI At A Glance
Analog Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ: ADI) is a global semiconductor leader that bridges the physical and digital worlds to enable breakthroughs at the Intelligent Edge. ADI combines analog, digital, and software technologies into solutions that help drive advancements in digitized factories, mobility, and digital healthcare, combat climate change, and reliably connect humans and the world. With revenue of more than $12 billion in FY22 and approximately 25,000 people globally working alongside 125,000 global customers, ADI ensures today’s innovators stay Ahead of What’s Possible.
The Group:
The charter of ADI’s CSI (Custom Silicon) team is to lead the market in selected technology domains with highly differentiated sensing and signal processing solutions. Today these technology areas include Capacitive Sensing, Optical Image Stabilization, Optical sensing and Audio which drive major growth in our portable Consumer business. With a goal to deliver sustainable growth the CSI group will present the successful candidate with a great opportunity for continuous career development as part of a highly motivated and supportive team.

The Position:
The group is seeking a Test Development Engineer to join our Limerick based team, working on the development of new product solutions for the areas listed above, for next generation portable product applications. Following extensive training and with continuous mentorship, the successful candidate will work closely with the new product development team as part of a multi-Engineer Test team, assuming responsibility for developing innovative, high performance, mass production ready hardware and software test solutions for our leading-edge product portfolio with a keen focus on cost optimization. This role will also provide opportunities to engage in the development of pre-silicon simulation and FPGA emulation solutions, along with extensive engagement with other functions such as Design, Applications, Quality etc.

Role and Responsibilities:
DFT definition & development to improve testability, quality and reduce cost.
Pre-tapeout verification of Test solutions using Design Simulation tools.
Design of innovative, reliable and efficient multi-site Probe and Test solutions on high performance mixed signal ATE platforms.
Execution of the Test development phase including Silicon functionality and debug, Characterization, Yield Analysis, solution optimization and Offshore Production release.
Support the fast ramp of ultra high-volume new products.
Interface with a broad range of groups such as Assembly, Reliability & FA, H/W technology etc.
Drive for continuous advancement of measurement methodologies through improvement initiatives.
Future leadership opportunities both at a project and personnel level.

BEng/MS degree in relevant field of study.
Strong knowledge of Analogue and Digital Electronics
Strong teamwork, inter-personal and communication skills are essential.
Be self-motivated, willing to take on responsibility, and show initiative in identifying and solving challenging technical problems.

At Provizio we are assembling a team with a mission to eradicate road deaths. We have developed a platform to perceive, predict and prevent crashes in real-time using proprietary long range imaging sensors & AI on-the-edge. AI decision-making will play a pivotal role in the future of auto safety, but only after we show it to reduce the edge cases that lead to crashes. Our goal is to get our technology into every moving vehicle in the world. We will learn from human drivers, and this will train our AI to make better decisions and eventually safety led autonomy. This is the greatest engineering and artificial intelligence challenge ever contemplated and we need the world's sharpest minds to join our mission.
Over the past 4 years, we've refined our systems to the point where we are now growing sales of our initial products.
Due to the nature of the product, our customers are other businesses, predominantly in the automotive sector, looking to improve their future commercial offerings by incorporating Provizio technology.
As we scale the release of our product to external customers, the need to adopt a scalable, reliable, and high-quality release process is essential. As such, a key component of this role will involve automating and improving the efficiency of our software/hardware testing, versioning, and release processes.
Finally, due to the nature of the product, some customers require on-site setup/integration support with their existing systems. As a result, any applicant must be willing to travel.

Key Responsibilities
The key responsibilities are:
Design, implementation, and maintenance of highly automated continuous deployment/release on demand systems.
Design, implementation, and maintenance of QA processes, with minimal manual overhead.
On-site product setup/integration support for customers as required.
Product integrity testing and data deployment (in-vehicle data recordings, storage, distribution).
You will work closely with both engineering and sales & marketing personnel to ensure that releases are appropriately scheduled, deployed, and supported.
You will be working in an agile work environment incorporating dynamic team structures and task tracking software (Jira) to manage the distribution and prioritisation of work items.

Essential Criteria:
Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical & Electronic Engineering, or related discipline.
3+ years’ professional Engineering experience
Freedom to travel.
Strong teamwork skills,Good social skills, Quick learner,Self-motivated.
Preferred Criteria:
Professional experience in a DevOps role (release management, CI/CD automation, testing, customer focused development/optimisation).
Agile experience preferred, with experience using task tracking software (e.g., Jira, Trello etc.).
Experience in Linux, Python, and shell scripting.
Location:
The role is on site, located at our office in Shannon (Ireland) with occasional travel anticipated both in Ireland and overseas.

Benefits:
Provizio offers a competitive salary, a 4-day work week, an employee share option scheme, a company pension scheme, and company led work life balance activities.
This role provides a great growth opportunity where you will find an empowered work environment, autonomous teams, distributed decision making and a flat organisation structure.
Provizio is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to the values of diversity, equitability, and inclusivity in the workplace where we prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind.
This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization and makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.

The successful candidate will be mentored by experienced team members as they gradually gain experience in the new role, which will include:
Working as part of an enthusiastic team to evaluate the performance of advanced mixed signal custom integrated circuits (IC’s) to ensure that they meet a range of performance specifications as set out by the design group.
Preparation in advance of receiving new silicon in the lab, which may include schematic design of PCB’s to facilitate various IC measurements. Experience with this schematic entry software will be gained on the job.
Use of a wide range of advanced test and measurement equipment to perform the various IC measurements across IC operating voltage and temperature ranges as specified by design.
Control of the overall measurement environment, from IC programming to T&M equipment control, through the use of our customized Python framework. An in-house Python training course is available for new graduates to achieve a proficient level of Python skills.
Acquisition and post processing of measurement data to determine performance against specifications along with subsequent documentation of results in appropriate formats.
The role will offer the successful candidate the opportunity to learn the processes and work involved in evaluating some of the most advanced custom IC’s being developed in the semiconductor industry today.
The role will offer the opportunity to develop skills in the areas of Python programming, PCB schematic entry using Cadence Allegro as well as master the soft skills required to use Excel, PowerPoint and Word to generate high quality data plots, bench results slide decks and evaluation reports for the duration of the projects being worked on.
